actions.committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

official_title: A bill to amend the Public Health Service Act with respect to providing financial assistance for certain trauma-care centers operating in geographic areas with a significant incidence of violence arising from the abuse of drugs.

summary.text: Trauma-Care Center Revitalization Act of 1990 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make grants for the operating expenses of trauma-care centers with substantial uncompensated costs in areas with significant violence arising from drug abuse. Gives priority to centers: (1) receiving State or political subdivision support not connected to any Federal program; (2) in areas where a trauma center has ceased participation; or (3) which, because of uncompensated costs, will be unable to participate in the trauma care system. Limits support for a center to three years, subject to extension by the Secretary for one additional year. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Public Health Service Act with respect to providing financial assistance for certain trauma-care centers operating in geographic areas with a significant incidence of violence arising from the abuse of drugs.
